page.title: 13HILTON STUDIOS Nr LICHFIELD.
page.content: The Studio which started in 1958, employs a group of highly specialised craftspeople. The work consists of making and maintaining Books of Remembrance for over 200 public authorities, mainly crematoria in Britain, but also in Canada, Sweden and South Africa. A Book of Remembrance is a large, fully bound volume weighing some 28lbs and containing a page for each day of the quarter on to which are copied beautiful inscriptions displayed on the anniversary of the date of death. At the moment the Studio are considering the possibilities of exporting single sheets of calligraphy, mini books and cards to reduce transportation costs. Other services provided include the making of honours books for universities and civic scrolls.
